title: Experimental: Slimefun but without CS-CoreLib
body:
## Description
<!-- Please explain what you changed/added and why you did it in detail. -->
For ~3 years we have been slowly but surely getting rid of the old CS-CoreLib code (CSCL 1 that is).
Sure, a lot of addons may still use methods from CSCL 1 but I made sure to transfer the three main classes that are still in use.

Note here that CSCL 1 has basically remained untouched since 2018 and bStats shows that literally **noone** is running any outdated versions. So the classes should all match, in case someone still uses CSCL1 (though, our classes should take priority when loaded...), the class signatures should still be compatible.

This may need much more testing though before this is ready to be merged.
We may announce this as a public beta.

## Changes
<!-- Please list all the changes you have made. -->
* Removed CS-CoreLib dependency from the `pom.xml`
* Removed CS-CoreLib as a `softDepend` from the `plugin.yml`
* Removed check for CS-CoreLib on startup
* Transferred any "still-in-use" classes from CS-CoreLib to the Slimefun src

## Checklist
<!-- Here is a little checklist you should follow. -->
<!-- You can click those check boxes after you posted your issue. -->
- [x] I have fully tested the proposed changes and promise that they will not break everything into chaos.
- [x] I have also tested the proposed changes in combination with various popular addons and can confirm my changes do not break them.
- [ ] I followed the existing code standards and didn't mess up the formatting.
- [ ] I did my best to add documentation to any public classes or methods I added.
- [ ] I have added `Nonnull` and `Nullable` annotations to my methods to indicate their behaviour for null values
- [ ] I added sufficient Unit Tests to cover my code.

title: Talisman of the Magician doesn't give extra enchantments on books, even when it says it does

labels.name: good first issue
labels.description: This is an Issue that may be easy to fix if you are a beginner

labels.name: üêû Bug Report
labels.description: A bug that needs to be fixed.

labels.name: üß® Confirmed Bug
labels.description: This bug has been confirmed by our team.

body:
<!-- FILL IN THE FORM BELOW -->

## :round_pushpin: Description (REQUIRED)
<!-- A clear and detailed description of what went wrong. -->
<!-- The more information you can provide, the easier we can handle this problem. -->
<!-- Start writing below this line -->
If you have a Talisman of the Magician in your inventory, enchanting a book in an enchanting table does not give an extra enchantment, even when the chat says "Your Talisman gave you an additional Enchantment."

## :bookmark_tabs: Steps to reproduce the Issue (REQUIRED)
<!-- Tell us the exact steps to reproduce this issue, the more detailed the easier we can reproduce it. -->
<!-- Youtube Videos and Screenshots are recommended!!! -->
<!-- Start writing below this line -->
1. Put a Talisman of the Magician in your inventory
2. Enchant a book in an enchanting table, with no bookshelves nearby. Repeat if necessary.
    ‚Üí You will receive only 1 enchantment on the book, even though the talisman said that it gave you an extra enchantment.

## :bulb: Expected behavior (REQUIRED)
<!-- What were you expecting to happen? -->
<!-- What do you think would have been the correct behaviour? -->
<!-- Start writing below this line -->
Since the talisman gives an "extra" enchantment, I would expect to get at least two enchantments on the book.

If the talisman is not supposed to give extra enchantments on books, then it should not say that it gave an extra enchantment when you enchant a book.

## :scroll: Server Log
<!-- Take a look at your Server Log and post any errors you can find via https://pastebin.com/ -->
<!-- If you are unsure about it, post your full log, you can find it under /logs/latest.log -->
<!-- Paste your link(s) below this line -->
No Notable Logs

## :open_file_folder: /error-reports/ Folder
<!-- Check the folder /plugins/Slimefun/error-reports/ and upload any files inside that folder. -->
<!-- You can also post these files via https://pastebin.com/ -->
<!-- Paste your link(s) below this line -->
No Error Reports

## :compass: Environment (REQUIRED)
<!-- Any info without the exact version numbers will be closed! -->
<!-- "latest" IS NOT A VERSION NUMBER. -->
<!-- We recommend running "/sf versions" and showing us a screenshot of that. -->
<!-- Make sure that the screenshot covers the entire output of that command. -->
<!-- If your issue is related to other plugins, make sure to include the versions of these plugins too! -->

title: Cargo Filters treat all potions as equal

labels.name: good first issue
labels.description: This is an Issue that may be easy to fix if you are a beginner

labels.name: üêû Bug Report
labels.description: A bug that needs to be fixed.

labels.name: üß® Confirmed Bug
labels.description: This bug has been confirmed by our team.

body:
<!-- FILL IN THE FORM BELOW -->

## :round_pushpin: Description (REQUIRED)
<!-- A clear and detailed description of what went wrong. -->
<!-- The more information you can provide, the easier we can handle this problem. -->
<!-- Start writing below this line -->
Cargo filters do not know the difference between potions. Water bottle is the same for cargo as Mundane Potion, Potion of Healing, Potion of Regeneration, etc. the same problem for throwers and I assume that for lingering

## :bookmark_tabs: Steps to reproduce the Issue (REQUIRED)
<!-- Tell us the exact steps to reproduce this issue, the more detailed the easier we can reproduce it. -->
<!-- Youtube Videos and Screenshots are recommended!!! -->
<!-- Start writing below this line -->
1. Place the chest and fill it with several different potions of the same type (normal, throwing or lingering)
2. Connect the Cargo Node (Input) to the chest and enable the blacklist in it.
3. Place the second chest and connect the Advanced Cargo Node (Output) to it
4. Insert any potion of the selected type in the first chest into the whitelist filter.
Video: https://youtu.be/euOi2rSkB5M
## :bulb: Expected behavior (REQUIRED)
<!-- What were you expecting to happen? -->
<!-- What do you think would have been the correct behaviour? -->
<!-- Start writing below this line -->
The cargo filter will distinguish potions.

<!-- Take a look at your Server Log and post any errors you can find via https://pastebin.com/ -->
<!-- If you are unsure about it, post your full log, you can find it under /logs/latest.log -->
<!-- Paste your link(s) below this line -->

title: Shulker within shulker in a cargo system.

labels.name: üêû Bug Report
labels.description: A bug that needs to be fixed.

labels.name: üß® Confirmed Bug
labels.description: This bug has been confirmed by our team.

body:
<!-- FILL IN THE FORM BELOW -->

## :round_pushpin: Description (REQUIRED)
<!-- A clear and detailed description of what went wrong. -->
<!-- The more information you can provide, the easier we can handle this problem. -->
<!-- Start writing below this line -->
You can place shulkers within shulkers using a cargo manager.

## :bookmark_tabs: Steps to reproduce the Issue (REQUIRED)
<!-- Tell us the exact steps to reproduce this issue, the more detailed the easier we can reproduce it. -->
<!-- Youtube Videos and Screenshots are recommended!!! -->
<!-- Start writing below this line -->
1. Create a cargo system by placing down your cargo manager.
2. Create the input by putting down a chest with a cargo note (input)
3. Create the output by putting down a shulker box with a cargo note (output)
4. Put shulker boxes into the input chest

https://puu.sh/H1Rtd/a417f1af67.png
https://puu.sh/H1Rte/f89f7fffba.png

## :bulb: Expected behavior (REQUIRED)
<!-- What were you expecting to happen? -->
<!-- What do you think would have been the correct behaviour? -->
<!-- Start writing below this line -->
Shulkers should be stacked instead of placed into a shulker.

<!-- Start writing below this line -->
Soulbound items do not drop out if when die in a world where disabled.

title: Experimental talismans
body:
## Description
Implement 2 new talismans, Talisman of the Wise and Talisman of the Resurrected. Also refactors the Talisman class quite a bit.

Regarding my Testing results below, I dont know if Ender Talismans are supposed to work in inventories, otherwise the only thing needed to fix is the ability to right click the Ender variant of the Talisman of the Resurrected.

## Changes
- Everything from the old PR
- Add a return statement so it doesnt send 2 messages

## Testing Results
@ ![img](https://cdn.discordapp.com/emojis/725813223797817372.png?v=1)

I did some thorough testing and came to the following results:
- Ender Talismans only work in enderchest, not in inventory
- Right clicking on the Ender Talisman of the Resurrected does not set a respawn point
- Both variants of the Talismans of the Anvil, Miner, Wise and Traveller work (I assume the rest works too but I didnt test all of them)

## Checklist
<!-- Here is a little checklist you should follow. -->
<!-- You can click those check boxes after you posted your issue. -->
- [x] I have fully tested the proposed changes and promise that they will not break everything into chaos.
- [x] I have also tested the proposed changes in combination with various popular addons and can confirm my changes do not break them.
- [x] I followed the existing code standards and didn't mess up the formatting.
- [ ] I did my best to add documentation to any public classes or methods I added.
- [x] I have added `Nonnull` and `Nullable` annotations to my methods to indicate their behaviour for null values
- [ ] I added sufficient Unit Tests to cover my code.

Open Android memory core. 2. Click to > Back button. 3. title: Added PR labels
body:
## Description
Made this action forever ago, was meant to add it in Hacktoberfest but... yeah.

Anyway, this adds labels to PRs based on the branch prefix. This is good for categorisation and helpful for people like myself for which PRs to look at first. We should add more labels but I thought these were some basic starting ones.

## Changes
* new workflow file to add labels

## Related Issues
N/A

## Checklist
<!-- Here is a little checklist you should follow. -->
<!-- You can click those check boxes after you posted your issue. -->
- [X] I have fully tested the proposed changes and promise that they will not break everything into chaos.
- [ ] I have also tested the proposed changes in combination with various popular addons and can confirm my changes do not break them.
- [ ] I followed the existing code standards and didn't mess up the formatting.
- [ ] I did my best to add documentation to any public classes or methods I added.
- [ ] I have added `Nonnull` and `Nullable` annotations to my methods to indicate their behaviour for null values
- [ ] I added sufficient Unit Tests to cover my code.

title: Add Tier 3 Electric Ore Grinder
body:
## Description
Add a tier 3 Electric Ore Grinder (reinforced plates, blistering ingots, T2 electric ore grinders and heating coils)
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/35664724/101268748-2c572580-3767-11eb-9821-42f387d723c1.png)

## Changes
- Add tier 3 Electric Ore Grinder to ResearchSetup of endgame grinding
- Add new SlimefunItemStack to `SlimefunItems.java`
- Add new ElectricOreGrinder to `SlimefunItemSetup.java`

## Feedback
I was very unsure about the recipe, seeing as the recipe for the Tier 2 Ore Grinder is also very pricy.
I was thinking of reducing their cost but instead I increased this cost.
Very open for discussion though!

title: Refactoring + Fixes to Block Handlers
body:
## Description
<!-- Please explain what you changed/added and why you did it in detail. -->
This Pull Request is meant to replace the old `SlimefunBlockHandler` in the future.
Slimefun has been using an `ItemHandler`-based system for quite some time now and block-breaking should finally be transferred over.
This will also fix two bugs.

title: Slimefun guide history doesn't retain pagination for the main menu

labels.name: üéØ Needs testing
labels.description: This Issue needs to be tested by our team to see if it can be reproduced.

labels.name: üêû Bug Report
labels.description: A bug that needs to be fixed.

body:
<!-- FILL IN THE FORM BELOW -->

## :round_pushpin: Description (REQUIRED)
<!-- A clear and detailed description of what went wrong. -->
<!-- The more information you can provide, the easier we can handle this problem. -->
<!-- Start writing below this line -->
Hi, I have issue (reported by players) in SF guide. When players open category on another page, for ex. on page 2, then when they click back button they aren't returned to previous page (the second), but to the first one, always. And they probably should be returned back to previous page, so page 2, it's a little bit annoying for them when they open category on page 2, then they click on back, appear on the first page, and have to click again on page 2 and then on another category... and imagine you're searching through categories and this really annoys you.

Same for sf cheat.

## :bookmark_tabs: Steps to reproduce the Issue (REQUIRED)
<!-- Tell us the exact steps to reproduce this issue, the more detailed the easier we can reproduce it. -->
<!-- Youtube Videos and Screenshots are recommended!!! -->
<!-- Start writing below this line -->
1. Give yourselves sf guide.
2. Open it.
3. Go on the next page (for ex. 2, may you need to add addons there).
4. Click on previous page (back button).
5. Now you're on the first page instead on the second one.
https://streamable.com/cmixva

## :bulb: Expected behavior (REQUIRED)
<!-- What were you expecting to happen? -->
<!-- What do you think would have been the correct behaviour? -->
<!-- Start writing below this line -->
It should go back to the second page, not to the first one, because it's annoying for players when they have to click and click through pages and then categories again and again.

## :compass: Environment (REQUIRED)
<!-- Any info without the exact version numbers will be closed! -->
<!-- "latest" IS NOT A VERSION NUMBER. -->
<!-- We recommend running "/sf versions" and showing us a screenshot of that. -->
<!-- Make sure that the screenshot covers the entire output of that command. -->
<!-- If your issue is related to other plugins, make sure to include the versions of these plugins too! -->

 - Server Software (Spigot/Paper): Paper
 - Minecraft Version: 1.16.4
 - Slimefun Version: 765
 - CS-CoreLib Version: 92

<!-- Start writing below this line -->
The infused elytra recipe does not work wit an elytra that has 2 NBT tags (= an elytra that has been repaired)

## :bookmark_tabs: Steps to reproduce the Issue (REQUIRED)
<!-- Tell us the exact steps to reproduce this issue, the more detailed the easier we can reproduce it. -->
<!-- Youtube Videos and Screenshots are recommended!!! -->

https://youtu.be/wIjm0KHJa38
https://gyazo.com/4ca3397e97c9a6111d5bc3ee9859e73c
3. Try to use this Elytra in the Infused Elytra recipe, it shows the "Incorrect Recipe" Message. When using a brand new Elytra in place of the repaired one, the recipe will work:
https://youtu.be/Cr1QNs0-7GI

## :bulb: Expected behavior (REQUIRED)
<!-- What were you expecting to happen? -->
<!-- What do you think would have been the correct behaviour? -->
<!-- Start writing below this line -->
The Infused Elytra recipe should also accept a fully repaired elytra as a crafting ingredient

title: Breaking Infused Hoppers with a hopper limitation applied doesn't subtract them from the hopper limit.

labels.name: üêû Bug Report
labels.description: A bug that needs to be fixed.

body:
<!-- FILL IN THE FORM BELOW -->

## :round_pushpin: Description (REQUIRED)
<!-- A clear and detailed description of what went wrong. -->
<!-- The more information you can provide, the easier we can handle this problem. -->
<!-- Start writing below this line -->
Placing an infused hopper down with a hopper limitation applied and then breaking said hopper will still count towards the hopper limitation. So if you for example have 1 hopper as a limit and you place down 1 infused hopper, then break the hopper, you can no longer place any other hoppers down. This only seems to happen with the infused hopper, regular hoppers and hoppers from other plugins work fine.

## :bookmark_tabs: Steps to reproduce the Issue (REQUIRED)
<!-- Tell us the exact steps to reproduce this issue, the more detailed the easier we can reproduce it. -->
<!-- Youtube Videos and Screenshots are recommended!!! -->
<!-- Start writing below this line -->
Set a hopper limit (Preferably 1 for easier testing).
Get an infused hopper and place it down.
Break infused hopper.
Try to place another hopper down (any) and it will tell you it's not possible.

## :bulb: Expected behavior (REQUIRED)
<!-- What were you expecting to happen? -->
<!-- What do you think would have been the correct behaviour? -->
<!-- Start writing below this line -->
Breaking the infused hopper should no longer count towards the limit.

## :scroll: Server Log
<!-- Take a look at your Server Log and post any errors you can find via https://pastebin.com/ -->
<!-- If you are unsure about it, post your full log, you can find it under /logs/latest.log -->
<!-- Paste your link(s) below this line -->
No errors but still got a link for you anyway:
https://pastebin.com/sFFGHfv3

## :open_file_folder: /error-reports/ Folder
<!-- Check the folder /plugins/Slimefun/error-reports/ and upload all files inside that folder. -->
<!-- You can also post these files via https://pastebin.com/ -->
<!-- Paste your link(s) below this line -->
The latest one was october 25th (Nearly a month ago) I figure you don't want those error reports
https://i.imgur.com/RPjcwgc.png

## :compass: Environment (REQUIRED)
<!-- Any info without the exact version numbers will be closed! -->
<!-- "latest" IS NOT A VERSION NUMBER. -->
<!-- We recommend running "/sf versions" and showing us a screenshot of that. -->
<!-- Make sure that the screenshot covers the entire output of that command. -->
<!-- If your issue is related to other plugins, make sure to include the versions of these plugins too! -->
I can't include it all in one screenshot so I split it in two with the last line being the first in the second:
https://i.imgur.com/v3IXQ2z.png
https://i.imgur.com/ODLFSO9.png

 - Server Software (Spigot/Paper): Yatopia
 - Minecraft Version: 1.16.4
 - Slimefun Version: vDEV - 744
 - CS-CoreLib Version: vDEV - 90

title: Refactored Block Tickers
body:
## Description
<!-- Please explain what you changed/added and why you did it in detail. -->
I am changing Block Tickers to go from an ItemHandler to a proper interface.
This makes identifying tickers easier and reduces the need for null checks on the getTicker() method, if something is a ticker, it is a ticker.

This also reduces nesting a LOT.
The only thing I am not so fond about yet is the getTickingMethod() method as it is quite a repetitive pattern.
I thought about determining this via sub interfaces of TickingBlock but those would just get confusing to implement for addon devs. The method forces them to implement it and make a decision, even if it may encourage redundance. If you have a better idea let me know.

This currently is just a wrapper for the old system, but this layer of abstraction will allow us to handle tickers internally however we want.

## Checklist
<!-- Here is a little checklist you should follow. -->
<!-- You can click those check boxes after you posted your issue. -->
- [x] I have fully tested the proposed changes and promise that they will not break everything into chaos.
- [x] I have also tested the proposed changes in combination with various popular addons and can confirm my changes do not break them.
- [x] I followed the existing code standards and didn't mess up the formatting.
- [x] I did my best to add documentation to any public classes or methods I added.
- [x] I have added `Nonnull` and `Nullable` annotations to my methods to indicate their behaviour for null values
- [ ] I added sufficient Unit Tests to cover my code.

title: Miner Androids cause block errors while mining

labels.name: üéØ Needs testing
labels.description: This Issue needs to be tested by our team to see if it can be reproduced.

labels.name: üêû Bug Report
labels.description: A bug that needs to be fixed.

body:
<!-- FILL IN THE FORM BELOW -->

## :round_pushpin: Description (REQUIRED)
<!-- A clear and detailed description of what went wrong. -->
<!-- The more information you can provide, the easier we can handle this problem. -->
<!-- Start writing below this line -->
When using Dig and Move Forward, androids sometimes create a block type disagreement. Here's an error:
https://pastebin.com/iNgjXg58
Once this block is corrupt, any kind of interaction produces console errors, including right clicking, left click, and breaking the block with an android. It does not behave like a ghost block, and players can place blocks inside it perfectly fine. It does not have any BlockStorage either.

In addition, I noticed that when a block is placed in a spot right after the android moves away from it, that block is broken and a Cs CoreLib head (android) appears in the android's inventory.

In addition to that addition, this also appeared and may help diagnose the problem: https://pastebin.com/fAcF5rCz

I have grouped all these issues together because they may be caused by the same source.

This issue may be related to #2408 and #2111 .

## :bookmark_tabs: Steps to reproduce the Issue (REQUIRED)
<!-- Tell us the exact steps to reproduce this issue, the more detailed the easier we can reproduce it. -->
<!-- Youtube Videos and Screenshots are recommended!!! -->
<!-- Start writing below this line -->
1. Place an android
2. Create a script that uses a combination of Move and Dig Forwards and Turn Right to create a loop that moves back and forth
3. After some time, errors may start to appear in console
4. Attempting to quickly place a block where the android used to be right after it moves will cause that block to be broken.

## :bulb: Expected behavior (REQUIRED)
<!-- What were you expecting to happen? -->
<!-- What do you think would have been the correct behaviour? -->
<!-- Start writing below this line -->
Androids should not bug out, and the tasks it performs should be executed in order.


## :scroll: Server Log
<!-- Take a look at your Server Log and post any errors you can find via https://pastebin.com/ -->
<!-- If you are unsure about it, post your full log, you can find it under /logs/latest.log -->
<!-- Paste your link(s) below this line -->
https://pastebin.com/iNgjXg58

## :open_file_folder: /error-reports/ Folder
<!-- Check the folder /plugins/Slimefun/error-reports/ and upload all files inside that folder. -->
<!-- You can also post these files via https://pastebin.com/ -->
<!-- Paste your link(s) below this line -->
https://pastebin.com/fAcF5rCz

## :compass: Environment (REQUIRED)
<!-- Any info without the exact version numbers will be closed! -->
<!-- "latest" IS NOT A VERSION NUMBER. -->
<!-- We recommend running "/sf versions" and showing us a screenshot of that. -->
<!-- Make sure that the screenshot covers the entire output of that command. -->
<!-- If your issue is related to other plugins, make sure to include the versions of these plugins too! -->

body:
## Description
Added more movement options to the Hologram, fixed colors, and _added a default goal to the pom_
Video: https://streamable.com/if78pz

## Changes
- Split the Y axis movement into a horizontal and vertical button
- Changed right click to move 0.5 blocks
- Mirrored Y for the X and Z axis by giving them their own parameters and click handlers
- Added a way to convert old holograms to the new format
- Fixed colors on all the text
- Got rid of the extra 1 added to the Y display (Shouldn't have been there in the first place, doesn't make sense)
- Filled up all the empty spots in the GUI so that players can not move items in
_- Added a defaultGoal to pom so that other contributors can build easier_

## Related Issues
N/A

title: Iron Golem creation from Iron Golem Assembler blocks and auto anvil blocks

labels.name: üêû Bug Report
labels.description: A bug that needs to be fixed.

labels.name: üß® Confirmed Bug
labels.description: This bug has been confirmed by our team.

body:
<!-- FILL IN THE FORM BELOW -->

## :round_pushpin: Description (REQUIRED)
<!-- A clear and detailed description of what went wrong. -->
<!-- The more information you can provide, the easier we can handle this problem. -->
<!-- Start writing below this line -->
The Iron Golem creation works from Iron Golem Assembler blocks, GPS teleporter matrix, and auto anvil blocks. This cause ghost blocks.

## :bookmark_tabs: Steps to reproduce the Issue (REQUIRED)
<!-- Tell us the exact steps to reproduce this issue, the more detailed the easier we can reproduce it. -->
<!-- Youtube Videos and Screenshots are recommended!!! -->
<!-- Start writing below this line -->
1. Build Iron Golem from Iron Golem Assembler blocks or GPS teleporter matrix or auto anvil blocks and Curved Pumpkin.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ay4D5EWaqO0

## :bulb: Expected behavior (REQUIRED)
<!-- What were you expecting to happen? -->
<!-- What do you think would have been the correct behaviour? -->

title: Programmable Android Optimization: Infinite Block Generators

labels.name: ‚ö° Merge Conflicts
labels.description: This Pull Request has merged conflicts which need to be resolved!

body:
## Description
<!-- Please explain what you changed/added and why you did it in detail. -->
This Pull Request proposes an optimization for Androids which shall reduce block updates and lag.
Instead of continously setting the block to AIR, it will simply play particles and sound effects as if the block had just been "generated". This also calls a `BlockFromToEvent`, so that custom cobble generator plugins won't be disturbed by this.

I will probably add Unit Tests for the various Generators too ~~(or make a Hacktoberfest issue for it ;D )~~

The generator detection will probably not be 100% accurate but it doesn't have to be, this is only to reduce lag for servers who use this excessively. And people with massive cobblestone farms are likely to use a pretty basic set up anyway.

here is a showcase of the detection in action:
https://youtu.be/oe7tu5WyUuw

## Checklist
<!-- Here is a little checklist you should follow. -->
<!-- You can click those check boxes after you posted your issue. -->
- [x] I have fully tested the proposed changes and promise that they will not break everything into chaos.
- [x] I have also tested the proposed changes in combination with various popular addons and can confirm my changes do not break them.
- [x] I followed the existing code standards and didn't mess up the formatting.
- [x] I did my best to add documentation to any public classes or methods I added.
- [x] I have added `Nonnull` and `Nullable` annotations to my methods to indicate their behaviour for null values
- [x] I added sufficient Unit Tests to cover my code.

title: Performance improvements on TickerTask <Tested>

labels.name: ‚ö° Merge Conflicts
labels.description: This Pull Request has merged conflicts which need to be resolved!

body:
## Description
<!-- Please explain what you changed/added and why you did it in detail. -->
A slimefun tick is now processed in seperate game ticks. This way lag spikes will be way less common but instead the lag will we spread out to several ticks/seconds.

## Changes
<!-- Please list all the changes you have made. -->
Many improvements in TickerTask.

## Related Issues
<!-- Please tag any Issues related to your Pull Request -->

title: Androids stop working and turn into CS core-lib heads

labels.name: üêû Bug Report
labels.description: A bug that needs to be fixed.

body:
## Description (Required)
<!-- A clear and detailed description of what exactly the Issue consists of. -->

When any android is given a program that includes movement off of it's initial position (not turning, but actual movement) given enough time (between 10 minutes and 4 hours on average) the androids cease to move, are no longer androids and turn back into heads.

## Steps to reproduce the Issue (Required)
<!-- Youtube Videos and Screenshots are recommended! -->

When writing a script that involves android movement forward up or down, after a period of time of the android running the script, the android no longer functions. When mined, it turns into a cs core-lib head. You cannot interact with the android. I have tested this with all types of androids and the same thing happens. The video below is from a lets play. I apologize but it's the only video I have. 

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=chHG6aJVsGw&t=74s

You should be able to see in the first few minutes the farm design i made and will see a number of androids have stopped. In the video i attempt to show you that the android interface cannot be brought up by right clicking the android. Instead it is now simply a head. 

In the video, the script that the farmer android has is as follows

Pull fuel, turn left, go forward, turn left (advanced harvest and replant, go forward) 9 times, push items into interface, turn left, go forward, turn left, (advanced harvest and replant, go forward) 9 times, then repeat.

## Expected behavior (Required)
<!-- What did you expect to happen? --> 

The androids should continue to function as expected instead of turning into heads.

## Server Log / Error Report
<!-- Take a look at your Server Log and please provide any error reports you can find via https://pastebin.com/ -->
<!-- We may discard your Issue if you just post it here, as it's unreadable for us. Please use Pastebin! -->

https://github.com/TheBusyBiscuit/Slimefun4/files/4962340/2020-07-11-2.log.zip

The error logs in slimefun only contained information relating to a barrel bug that has also been reported.

## Environment (Required)
<!-- We may also close your Issue if you are not providing the exact version numbers. -->
<!-- "latest" IS NOT A VERSION NUMBER. -->
<!-- You can also just run "/sf versions" and show us a screenshot of that. -->

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/40214829/88232209-14a95580-cc3b-11ea-8102-40b97df8ee97.png)


 - Minecraft Version: Minecraft 1.15.2
 - Slimefun Version:

 - CS-CoreLib Version:

title: Cargo system voids items transferred at specifc times

labels.name: üêû Bug Report
labels.description: A bug that needs to be fixed.

body:
## Description
The cargo system can transfer items to blocks which technically do not exist anymore
More specific in the time window between the block being destroyed on the main thread (dropping the current content of the inventory) and the actual removal from the BlockStorage, the cargo system can transfer items to the inventory which will be voided

## Steps to reproduce the Issue
1. Create a simple cargo setup consisting of one cargo manager, one cargo input node and one cargo output node
2. Configure the cargo system in such way that it is transferring items into a slimefun managed inventory container, such as the "Electric Furnace"
3. Destroy the Electric Furnace exactly after the TickerTask has processed Block removals and before it starts processing the tick of the cargo manager
4. Observe how items are transferred into the destroyed Electric Furnace and are destroyed immediately afterwards as the TickerTask processes the removal of the Electric Furnace 

From my testing this is a very rare occasion, and as such a very hard bug to reproduce.
However, with the help of a debugger which is capable of pausing the async TickerTask, it is reproducible every time

## Expected behavior
The item does not transfer, or drops in the world

## Environment
 - Minecraft Version: v1_15_R1
 - Slimefun Version: DEV 489 (git d8964)
 - CS-CoreLib Version: v1.6.3

title: Automated Crafting Chamber ignores crafting-permissions

labels.name: üêû Bug Report
labels.description: A bug that needs to be fixed.

labels.name: üß® Confirmed Bug
labels.description: This bug has been confirmed by our team.

body:
## Description (Required)
<!-- A clear and detailed description of what exactly the Issue consists of. -->
Individual permissions for sf items only work in the Enchanted Crafting Table. Using the Automated Crafting Chamber bypasses these permissions giving players the ability to craft these items even if they don't have the required permission.
## Steps to reproduce the Issue (Required)
<!-- Youtube Videos and Screenshots are recommended! -->
Set permission for an item in the items.yml, try crafting in enchanted table and get denied, then craft in automated crafting table.
## Expected behavior (Required)
<!-- What did you expect to happen? -->

## Server Log / Error Report
<!-- Take a look at your Server Log and please provide any error reports you can find via https://pastebin.com/ -->
<!-- We may discard your Issue if you just post it here, as it's unreadable for us. Please use Pastebin! -->
No logs required for this.

## Environment (Required)
<!-- We may also close your Issue if you are not providing the exact version numbers. -->
<!-- "latest" IS NOT A VERSION NUMBER. -->
<!-- You can also just run "/sf versions" and show us a screenshot of that. -->

 - Minecraft Version: 1.14.4 Paper #209
 - Slimefun Version: Slimefun4 - DEV 276 (git 74ee0)
 - CS-CoreLib Version: CS-CoreLib - DEV 77 (git 6e171)

title: Cargo Input Nodes don't transfer whitelisted Items if not-whitelisted items come first

labels.name: üêû Bug Report
labels.description: A bug that needs to be fixed.

body:
## Description
With an Input Node in Blacklist mode and no items blacklisted, connected to a chest with an Advanced Output Node with an item whitelisted, if any items are blocking the slots before the whitelisted item in the input chest with nowhere to go, the whitelisted item never gets transported.

## Evidence / Proof
GIF: https://i.gyazo.com/7199e6c7f7e7f173fa3c7f1dfa778efc.gif

## Environment
MC version: 1.11.2 (git-Paper-1032)
CS-CoreLib version: 1.5.12
Slimefun version: 4.1.1
